reviewText: Fun little video.\n\nI don't see why people are complaining about the content when the description video is exactly what you see, and people complaining about paying for it. If you want everything for free then go somewhere else, or you can help support someone's hard work. I had this when it was free and even so I still bought this one, even though I'm not going to watch it again. It's not the best, but it's fun. Show it to your friends, and help support indie development.

reviewText: I got this thinking it would be a fun distraction for my child while I tended to chores, when I came back into the room my dear little William was in tears. I took one look at the screen and was appalled! This product is completely tastless and lacks all respect for children like my little William. William has a rare condition where he was born without a butt and all the blatant flaunting of tooshies in this was very traumatic for him. I'm going to have to double down on the therapy now!\n\nA++ would watch again

reviewText:
I love this game.

I don't know what it is but the development of the story and the adventures just expand this game far more than a regular farm game.

30 hours. Thats how long I've played the game in my first 48 hours of buying it. It's wonderful.

The storyline and progressive character development makes you feel warm and happy with each action you take. This goes beyond just the realm of farming. Stardew valley is a farming, rpg, simulation, and romantic game that takes you on a journey to see another side of life.

Absolutely recommend it to anyone. I didn't think it would suit me because it was just another farm game" but it turned out to be one of the most heart warming

It's a short animation and its entirety iliterally on the store page. I recieved it as a gift, I assume 99% of the purchases are as a gag gift, but $1 is way too expensive for what you get.\n\nIf there was interaction or a longer animation then I could jusitify the $1. I would not pay more than $0.50 for this product.
